monuments.name: Taras Shevchenko
monuments.address: Born in 1814 in Moryntsi, he is revered as the father of Ukrainian literature
monuments.description: Taras Shevchenko (1814-1861) was a Ukrainian poet, writer, artist, and political figure. Born into serfdom in Moryntsi, Ukraine, Shevchenko rose to prominence as a literary and cultural icon, advocating for the rights and freedoms of the Ukrainian people through his poetry and artwork. His works, including the epic poem Kobzar, continue to inspire generations and hold a central place in Ukrainian literature and national identity.

monuments.name: Ivan Franko
monuments.address: Born in 1856 in Nahuievychi, he was a prolific writer and social activist
monuments.description: Ivan Franko (1856-1916) was a Ukrainian poet, writer, philosopher, and political activist. Born in Nahuievychi, Ukraine, Franko played a pivotal role in the development of Ukrainian literature and culture during the late 19th and early 20th centuries. His extensive body of work encompasses poetry, prose, drama, and literary criticism, reflecting his commitment to social justice, national liberation, and humanism.

monuments.name: Lesya Ukrainka
monuments.address: Born in 1871 in Novohrad-Volynskyi, a leading voice in Ukrainian literature and culture
monuments.description: Lesya Ukrainka (1871-1913) was a prominent Ukrainian poet, playwright, and feminist activist. Born in Novohrad-Volynskyi, Ukraine, she defied social norms of her time and made significant contributions to Ukrainian literature and culture. Ukrainka's poetic works explore themes of love, freedom, and the struggle for national identity, earning her a place among Ukraine's literary giants.

monuments.name: Mykhailo Kotsiubynsky
monuments.address: Born in 1864 in Vinnytsia, known for his realist novels
monuments.description: Mykhailo Kotsiubynsky (1864-1913) was a Ukrainian realist writer known for his novels and short stories depicting life in rural Ukraine. Born in Vinnytsia, Kotsiubynsky's works reflect the socio-economic and cultural realities of his time, offering profound insights into the human condition. His literary legacy continues to resonate with readers for its authenticity and emotional depth.

monuments.name: Vasyl Stefanyk
monuments.address: Born in 1871 in Rusiv, acclaimed for his lyrical prose
monuments.description: Vasyl Stefanyk (1871-1936) was a Ukrainian writer celebrated for his lyrical prose and psychological depth. Born in Rusiv, Ukraine, Stefanyk's works often explore the complexities of human nature, love, and the beauty of rural life. His contributions to Ukrainian literature have earned him a place as one of the most revered authors of the early 20th century.

monuments.name: Pavlo Tychyna
monuments.address: Born in 1891 in Pisky, renowned for his modernist exploration
monuments.description: Pavlo Tychyna (1891-1967) was a leading figure of Ukrainian modernism, renowned for his innovative poetry exploring themes of nature, spirituality, and the human experience. Born in Pisky, Ukraine, Tychyna's works transcend stylistic boundaries and continue to inspire with their profound philosophical insights and artistic brilliance.

monuments.name: Bohdan-Ihor Antonych
monuments.address: Born in 1909 in Novy Svet, Crimea, a pioneering poet
monuments.description: Bohdan-Ihor Antonych (1909-1937) was an avant-garde poet known for his experimental style and symbolic imagery. Born in Novy Svet, Crimea, he played a pioneering role in Ukrainian literature of the early 20th century. Antonych's poetry, marked by its surrealism and introspection, remains influential and highly regarded in Ukrainian literary circles.

monuments.name: Lina Kostenko
monuments.address: Born in 1930 in Rzhyshchiv, known for her socially engaged and lyrical poetry
monuments.description: Lina Kostenko (1930-present) is a contemporary Ukrainian poet, writer, and public intellectual. Born in Rzhyshchiv, Ukraine, she is known for her socially engaged poetry, exploring themes of love, war, and the struggle for human dignity. Kostenko's powerful voice and lyrical expression have earned her widespread acclaim and recognition as one of Ukraine's most esteemed literary figures.

monuments.name: Yuriy Andrukhovych
monuments.address: Born in 1960 in Stanislav (now Ivano-Frankivsk), a leading contemporary writer
monuments.description: Yuriy Andrukhovych (1960-present) is a leading contemporary Ukrainian writer known for his innovative prose and poetic style. Born in Stanislav (now Ivano-Frankivsk), Ukraine, Andrukhovych's works often blend postmodernist techniques with historical and cultural themes, capturing the complexities of modern Ukrainian society with wit and depth.

monuments.name: Serhiy Zhadan
monuments.address: Born in 1974 in Starobilsk, known for his powerful portrayal
monuments.description: Serhiy Zhadan (1974-present) is a prominent Ukrainian writer, poet, and musician. Born in Starobilsk, Ukraine, Zhadan is celebrated for his powerful portrayal of contemporary Ukrainian realities in his works. His poetry and prose reflect the social upheaval, war, and search for identity in modern Ukraine, earning him both critical acclaim and a devoted readership.

monuments.name: Mykola Lysenko
monuments.address: Born 1842 in Hrynky, the father of Ukrainian classical music, blending folk melodies into compositions, shaping the nation's music.
monuments.description: Mykola Lysenko (1842-1912) was a prominent Ukrainian composer, educator, and conductor. Born in the village of Hrynky in Kyiv Oblast, he is renowned as the father of Ukrainian classical music, incorporating Ukrainian folk melodies into his compositions, thereby shaping the nation's musical identity.

monuments.name: Myroslav Skoryk
monuments.address: Born 1938 in Lviv, blends traditional and modern music, enriching Ukrainian melodies
monuments.description: Myroslav Skoryk (born 1938) is a celebrated Ukrainian composer and pianist. Born in Lviv, his music is known for its fusion of traditional Ukrainian melodies with contemporary compositional techniques, enriching the cultural heritage of Ukraine.

monuments.name: Borys Lyatoshynsky
monuments.address: Born 1895 in Zhytomyr, his symphonies reflect Ukrainian themes, leaving a mark on classical music
monuments.description: Borys Lyatoshynsky (1895-1968) was a distinguished Ukrainian composer born in Zhytomyr. His symphonies are renowned for their depth and reflection of Ukrainian themes, establishing him as a significant figure in Ukrainian classical music.

monuments.name: Ihor Stravinsky
monuments.address: Born 1882 in Khorol, known for rich orchestration and harmonies, influencing many
monuments.description: Ihor Stravinsky (1882-1971) was a Ukrainian conductor and composer, born in Khorol. He is renowned for his rich orchestral arrangements and harmonic language, influencing musicians worldwide.

monuments.name: Volodymyr Ivasyuk
monuments.address: Born 1949 in Kitsman, his folk songs embody Ukrainian spirit, beloved by many
monuments.description: Volodymyr Ivasyuk (1949-1979) was a Ukrainian singer-songwriter born in Kitsman. His folk songs embody the spirit of Ukraine, endearing him to audiences and leaving a lasting impact on Ukrainian music.

monuments.name: Oleh Skrypka
monuments.address: Born 1964 in Lviv, a rock legend, his lyrics shape cultural conversations
monuments.description: Oleh Skrypka (born 1964) is a legendary figure in Ukrainian rock music, born in Lviv. Known for his active participation in public life, as well as for the socially significant lyrics of his songs.

monuments.name: Valentin Silvestrov
monuments.address: Born 1937 in Kyiv, merges folk into contemporary music, enriching Ukrainian culture
monuments.description: Valentin Silvestrov (born 1937) is a renowned Ukrainian composer, born in Kyiv. His works are known for their integration of Ukrainian folk melodies with elements of contemporary classical music, enriching Ukrainian culture.

monuments.name: Svyatoslav Richter
monuments.address: Born 1915 in Zhytomyr, a piano virtuoso, his legacy reverberates in classical music
monuments.description: Svyatoslav Richter (1915-1997) was a legendary Russian pianist, born in Zhytomyr. His exceptional talent and technique continue to leave an indelible mark on the world of classical music.

monuments.name: Ani Lorak
monuments.address: Born 1978 in Kitsman, she captivated audiences at Eurovision 2008 with her powerful voice
monuments.description: Ani Lorak (born 1978) is a popular Ukrainian pop singer, born in Kitsman. She gained prominence after representing Ukraine in the Eurovision Song Contest 2008, captivating audiences with her powerful voice.

monuments.name: Bohdan Stupka
monuments.address: Born in 1941 in Kulykiv, he was a revered Ukrainian actor, leaving a lasting impact on theater, film, and television
monuments.description: Born in 1941 in Kulykivka. Starting his career in theater, he quickly became a recognized Ukrainian actor known for his versatile roles in both theater and cinema, leaving a significant impact on Ukrainian cultural heritage.

monuments.name: Mariana Sadovska-Chorna
monuments.address: Born in 1947 in Lviv, she was a distinguished actress known for her powerful performances
monuments.description: Born in 1947 in Lviv. Her acting career began on the Lviv stage, where she progressed from a young talent to a recognized master of her craft. She is known for her impressive performances, blending talent, emotional depth, and professional skill.

monuments.name: Olga Kurylenko
monuments.address: Born in 1979 in Berdiansk, she is an internationally renowned actress, famous for her roles in blockbuster films
monuments.description: Born in 1979 in Berdiansk. Starting as a model, she rose to international fame with roles in major Hollywood blockbusters. Her high professionalism and talent made her one of the most successful Ukrainian actresses in the world of cinema.

monuments.name: Serhiy Mykhalchuk
monuments.address: Born in 1954 in Kyiv, he was a beloved Ukrainian actor celebrated for his iconic performances
monuments.description: Born in 1954 in Kyiv. His acting talent was evident from a young age, and he became one of the most well-known and respected Ukrainian actors, famous for his iconic performances and warm rapport with audiences.

monuments.name: Ada Rogovtseva
monuments.address: Born in 1937 in Zhytomyr, she was a legendary actress known for her exceptional talent
monuments.description: Born in 1937 in Zhytomyr. She was recognized as one of the most talented actresses of her generation, playing numerous unforgettable roles in theater, film, and television. Her subtle acting skills combined with a deep understanding of character psychology earned her acclaim from both critics and audiences alike.

monuments.name: Petro Benyuk
monuments.address: Born in 1962 in Kosiv, he is a highly acclaimed Ukrainian actor known for his versatility
monuments.description: Born in 1962 in Kosiv. His talent and professionalism have earned him great recognition both among colleagues and audiences. He is known for his ability to deliver insightful and witty performances, effortlessly embodying complex characters with unmatched ease.

monuments.name: Maria Zankovetska
monuments.address: Born in 1854 in Pryluky, she was a pioneering Ukrainian actress, considered one of the greatest stage performers of her time
monuments.description: Born in 1854 in Pryluky. She became one of the first great actresses of the Ukrainian stage, captivating audiences with her unmatched performances and talent. Her influence on the development of theatrical art in Ukraine was immensely significant, and her name remains an integral part of Ukrainian cultural history.

monuments.name: Andriy Sereda
monuments.address: Born in 1960 in Kyiv, he was a celebrated Ukrainian actor known for his memorable roles
monuments.description: Born in 1960 in Kyiv. His talent and professionalism have made him one of the most popular and respected actors on the Ukrainian stage. He is known for his unmatched performances in both tragic and comedic roles, winning the hearts of audiences with his striking emotional expressiveness.

monuments.name: Larysa Kadochnikova
monuments.address: Born in 1942 in Kyiv, she was a distinguished actress known for her captivating presence
monuments.description: Born in 1942 in Kyiv. She was recognized for her unparalleled acting abilities and the warmth she brought to her roles. Her performances garnered great acclaim from Ukrainian and international audiences, and her contribution to the development of Ukrainian cinema and theater is incredibly significant.

monuments.name: Viktor Stepanenko
monuments.address: Born in 1944 in Dnipro, he was a revered Ukrainian actor known for his profound dedication to his craft
monuments.description: Born in 1944 in Dnipro. He was a highly esteemed actor, known for his deep devotion to the arts and immense talent. His performances were always remarkably authentic and striking, and his contribution to the development of Ukrainian culture is immeasurable.

monuments.name: Daria Shapovalova
monuments.address: Born in 1985 in Kyiv, she became one of the leading figures in the Ukrainian fashion industry, founding Kyiv Fashion Week and becoming a symbol of the Ukrainian fashion world
monuments.description: Born in Kyiv in 1985, Daria Shapovalova rose to prominence as a leading figure in Ukrainian fashion. She founded Kyiv Fashion Week, showcasing local talent on the international stage and fostering the growth of Ukraine's fashion industry.

monuments.name: Anna October
monuments.address: Born in 1983 in Kyiv, she is known for her unique design and innovative approach to fashion, impressing fashion capitals worldwide
monuments.description: Anna October, born in Kyiv in 1983, is celebrated for her unique designs and innovative approach to fashion. Her collections blend contemporary aesthetics with traditional Ukrainian craftsmanship, earning her recognition both at home and abroad.

monuments.name: Oleksiy Zalevskiy
monuments.address: Born in 1985 in Kyiv, he became known as a fashion designer whose collections were distinguished by sophistication and unmatched style
monuments.description: Born in Kyiv in 1985, Oleksiy Zalevskiy gained renown as a fashion designer renowned for his sophisticated and refined collections. His designs seamlessly merge classic elegance with modern trends, captivating audiences with their timeless appeal.

monuments.name: Anton Belinskiy
monuments.address: Born in 1987 in Kyiv, his name became synonymous with Ukrainian fashion, noted for his bold and innovative designs
monuments.description: Anton Belinskiy, born in Kyiv in 1987, emerged as a prominent figure in Ukrainian fashion, known for his bold and avant-garde designs. His innovative collections push boundaries and challenge conventions, earning him acclaim as a visionary in the industry.

monuments.name: Lilia Poustovit
monuments.address: Born in 1976 in Dnipro, she became famous for her feminine and elegant collections, reflecting the spirit of contemporary Ukrainian fashion
monuments.description: Lilia Poustovit, born in Dnipro in 1976, is revered for her feminine and elegant designs that embody the essence of contemporary Ukrainian fashion. With a focus on simplicity and sophistication, her collections have garnered praise for their timeless beauty and universal appeal.

monuments.name: Jean Gritsfeldt
monuments.address: Born in 1989 in Lviv, he is known for his extravagant and futuristic designs, which have earned him great popularity both in Ukraine and abroad
monuments.description: Born in Lviv in 1989, Jean Gritsfeldt is renowned for his avant-garde and futuristic designs that push the boundaries of fashion. His creations, characterized by bold silhouettes and innovative materials, have earned him international recognition as a trailblazer in the industry.

monuments.name: Svitlana Bevza
monuments.address: Born in 1978 in Lviv, she became known for her minimalist and elegant collections, recognized both nationally and internationally
monuments.description: Bevza, born in Lviv in 1978, is celebrated for her minimalist yet sophisticated aesthetic that redefines contemporary Ukrainian fashion. Her clean lines and refined silhouettes reflect a timeless elegance, making her designs a favorite among discerning fashion enthusiasts worldwide.

monuments.name: Ivan Frolov
monuments.address: Born in 1989 in Kyiv, he is famous for his extravagant designs that stand out for their provocative and daring style
monuments.description: Ivan Frolov, born in Kyiv in 1989, is known for his daring and provocative designs that challenge conventional notions of beauty. His avant-garde collections, characterized by bold colors and unexpected textures, have established him as a visionary in the Ukrainian fashion scene.

monuments.name: Yulia Magdych
monuments.address: Born in 1985 in Kyiv, she is known for her exquisite and unique embroidered garments, which have become a true symbol of Ukrainian culture
monuments.description: Yulia Magdych, born in Kyiv in 1985, is renowned for her intricate and beautifully crafted embroidered garments that celebrate Ukrainian heritage. Her designs, inspired by traditional motifs and techniques, capture the essence of Ukrainian culture while appealing to a modern audience.

monuments.name: Ksenia Schnaider
monuments.address: Born in 1983 in Kyiv, she is known for her innovative denim creations, making her one of the leading figures in the Ukrainian fashion scene
monuments.description: Ksenia Schnaider, born in Kyiv in 1983, gained recognition for her innovative approach to denim design, reimagining classic styles with a contemporary twist. Her boundary-pushing collections, known for their unexpected silhouettes and unconventional details, have solidified her reputation as a maverick in the fashion world.

monuments.name: Regional Department of the Security Service of Ukraine in Chernihiv region
monuments.address: Shevchenko Street, 28, Chernihiv, Chernihiv region
monuments.description:
The two-story building of the district court was built in 1904 by architect E. Yanovsky. 

Until October 1917, it housed the district court, later - the Soviet institutions.

monuments.name: Spaso-Preobrazhensʹka (Transfiguration) Church
monuments.address: Yuvileina Street, 24, Volnovakha, Donetsk region
monuments.description:
The Transfiguration Community was organized in 1991. 

Initially, worships were held in an ordinary church, which was reconsecrated in the name of the Tikhvin Icon of the Mother of God, after the newly-built church opened its doors in 1999. 

Volvovakha inhabitants especailly revere the image of the Mother of God. 

There is a Sunday school and an Orthodox library at Spaso-Preobrazhensʹka (Transfiguration) Church.

monuments.name: Kyiv TV Tower
monuments.address: Dorogozhytska Street, 10, Kyiv
monuments.description: The world's first full-metal tower and the tallest free lattice TV tower. It is the highest building in Ukraine, 385 meters long, which can be seen from almost any corner of Kyiv. The construction of the tower was carried out by the method of superstructure "from top to down" without the use of cranes and screws.

monuments.name: Rizdva Presviatoyi Bohorodytsi Church
monuments.address: Kyivska Street, 2a, Yasnohorodka village, Kyiv region
monuments.description: The first church in Yasnohorodka was built in the first half of the XVIII century. During Khrushchev's persecution, the temple was destroyed. The new church was built in 2008, and in 2012 the parish community asked the Ukrainian Orthodox Church to appoint a priest. Since July 12, 2012, father Roman Zadorozhny has been the rector of the parish.

monuments.name: Okhtyrka City Council
monuments.address: Nezalezhnosti Street, 11, Okhtyrka, Sumy Region
monuments.description: A vintage Okhtyrka сity сouncil building was constructed in the late 1940s at the spot of an old military warehouse.

monuments.name: Church of the Holy Queen Tamara
monuments.address: Academika Kurchatova Street, 16, Kharkiv, Kharkiv district, Kharkiv region
monuments.description:
On March 7, 2012, Archbishop Onuphriy of Kharkiv and Bohodukhiv consecrated a site for a future church with an area of  375.5 square meters, 29 meters high, with a capacity of over 150 people. 

On August 23, 2013, Onuphriy consecrated the church in honor of the pious Queen Tamara, which became the first church in the city and region honouring of this saint.

monuments.name: Public Administration Building
monuments.address: 40th Army Square, Trostyanets, Sumy region
monuments.description: The administrative building in Trostianets constructed in late XIX century.

monuments.name: Village library
monuments.address: Central’na Street, 2, Soldats'ke village, Sumy Region
monuments.description: A modern building where a local branch of the Trostyanets Public Library is located.

monuments.name: Church of Saint Matrona of Moscow
monuments.address: Volodymyrska Street, 6, Rubizhne, Severodonetsk district, Luhansk region
monuments.description: A modern Ukrainian Orthodox church, constructed in the name of Saint Matrona Moskovs’ka. The construction was carried out through the reconstruction of a building that was adapted for being a church. Metropolitan Nykodym consecrated the cross and the dome for the church’s bell tower in November 2021.

monuments.name: Church of the Nativity of the Blessed Virgin
monuments.address: Peremoha village, Brovarsyi district, Kyiv region
monuments.description:
An older church with the same name was mentioned, at least in the middle of the 17th century. 

The modern wooden church of the Nativity of the Mother of God was built with the charity money of the Yadlivka village community (which from 1945 has the name Peremoha) in 1892. 

In 1934, the church was closed for services, and the top part was destroyed (the bell tower was destroyed too). 

The church itself was reconstructed for other needs — at a different time, there was school or club. 

During WWII, Yadlivka was completely burned down, and the only building that survived was this church.

monuments.name: The Kharkiv regional state administration building
monuments.address: Sumska Street, 64, Kharkiv, Kharkiv district, Kharkiv region
monuments.description: The building is an important local cultural site. It was monumented in 1951 for The Communist Party of Ukraine.

monuments.name: Church of the Icon of Our Lady of Kazan
monuments.address: Kotsyubynska Street, 5, Chernihiv, Chernihiv district, Chernihiv region
monuments.description: The church of the Icon of Mother of God of Kazan is a significant historical and architectural monument, which was built in 1820-1827 in honor of the victory in the Franco-Russian War of 1812. It was reconstructed in the middle of the XIX century.  It was used as a cinema after 1943.  The Kazan Church housed a repair and installation plant of the Ukrholovtorhtehnika of the Ministry of Trade in 1984. In the 1990's, the church was returned to the religious community (Ukrainian Orthodox Church of the Moscow Patriarchate).

monuments.name: Memorial "Glory to Ukraine"
monuments.address: Perekopska street, 3, Kherson, Kherson district, Kherson region
monuments.description:
The Memorial to the heroes of the Heavenly Hundred and the heroes of ATO (Joint Forces Operation) was opened during the celebration of the National Flag Day in Kherson in 2016. 

The Memorial includes the pictures of 69 Kherson region residents who lost their lives during ATO in the East of Ukraine.

monuments.name: St. Nicholas Church
monuments.address: Pershotravneva Street, 41, Popasna, Sievierodonetsk District, Luhansk region
monuments.description: The construction of the church began in 1907, and by 1909 the first Easter service was held there. The church was used as a granary and stable by the communist totalitarian government from the summer of 1936 to 1941. The Germans allowed the church to open in the spring of 1942, and services resumed after minor renovations, but were ceased in 1961. Later, they converted the church into a club and library. The church opened its doors again in 1989, and had not closed them up until the Russian invasion of Ukraine in 2022.

monuments.name: Trostianets Forest Research Station
monuments.address: Neskuchanska Street, 15, Trostianets, Okhtyrka district, Sumy region
monuments.description: Trostianets forest park was founded in the picturesque tract Neskuchne on the banks of a complex of ponds, formed in places where river Trostianka used to flow. High and steep hillsides of the river valley were covered with age-old oakery. The live collection of Trostianets forest park was rather broad, including examples of gymnosperms like larches, pines, firs and spruces. Visitors could admire a lot of amazing types of the larch tree, among which the European, Dahurian, Siberian, Sukachev, Chekanovsky and Japanese ones.

monuments.name: Memorial House of Hryhorii Skovoroda
monuments.address: Pryozerna Street, 3, Skovorodýnivka, Bohodukhiv district, Kharkiv region
monuments.description: Hryhorii Skovoroda National Literary Memorial Museum is located in the house of the Kovalivski landowners, built in the XVIII century as a garden pavilion. The first two halls of the museum are dedicated to the author's biography and works, and the third hall - to the legacy of the famous philosopher. The memorial room ('quiet cell'), where Hryhorii Skovoroda lived and died, was also open for visitors. The exposition of the museum includes publications of Skovoroda's works, literature about him, books of ancient, medieval, and modern philosophers and poets studied by Skovoroda, ethnographic objects, paintings, and graphic works related to Skovoroda.

monuments.name: City House of Culture
monuments.address: Peremohy Square, 1, Derhachi, Kharkiv district, Kharkiv region
monuments.description: The total area of the institution is 5833.64 sq.m., an auditorium with 460 seats (424.3 sq.m.), a small hall, a festive hall, a dance hall, a gym, and rooms for group classes and extracurricular club formations, 4 artistic and methodical rooms.

monuments.name: Tramcar “MTP-82”
monuments.address: Traktorobudivnykiv Ave, 109, Kharkiv, Kharkiv district, Kharkiv region
monuments.description: A Soviet high-floor four-axis one-sided motor-powered tramcar. The abbreviation “MTP” stands for “Moscow Tramcar Plant.” The first prototype was built on a military plant №82 (that’s where the “82” index in the name comes from) in 1946. Tramcars of this brand functioned in many Soviet cities until the end of the 1970's.

monuments.name: Church of Mother-of-God of Kazan icon
monuments.address: Druzhby Ave, 27a, Mar'inka, Pokrovskyi district, Donetsk region
monuments.description: In the middle of the XIX century, the first wooden church of Mother of God of Kazan icon was erected in Maryinka.  The newly built brick church was consecrated in 1906. Later, in the 1930's, it was destroyed. The church was reconstructed at the beginning of the 1990's.

monuments.name: Christ Ressurection Сhurch
monuments.address: Rudnytske village, Brovarskyj district, Kyiv region
monuments.description:
In 1869, thanks to God-loving villagers of Rudnytske, a wooden temple was built in honor of the Resurrection of Christ. 

Despite all the vicissitudes of history, it stood in Rudnytske until 1987, when it was ruined at the dawn of the Soviet restructuring campaign. 

Six months later, similar temples began to be restored throughout the Soviet Union.

monuments.name: St. Volodymyr's Church
monuments.address: Kyivska Street, 45, Mariupol', Mariupol' district, Donetsk region
monuments.description: The Orthodox community was registered in the Mariupol' district in July 1999. On the anniversary of the Baptism of Rus a church in the honor of Grand Prince Volodymyr, the Baptizer of all Rus, opened its doors on Kyivska Street.

monuments.name: Church of Mother-of-God of Smolensk icon
monuments.address: Seminarska Street, 46, Kharkiv, Kharkiv district, Kharkiv region
monuments.description: From 1879 to 1882 P. Grabowski studied in the former XIX century seminary building. In 2012, his Excellency Metropolitan of Kharkiv and Bohodukhiv Nikodim initiated and blessed the establishment of the Smolensk Mother of God community. This icon serves as a degender of canonical orthodoxy. It also preserves the spiritual traditions that come from orthodontic Byzantine.

monuments.name: Saints-Uspensky cathedral
monuments.address: Universytetska Street, 11, Kharkiv, Kharkiv district, Kharkiv region
monuments.description: This Cathedral is the oldest church in Kharkiv, therefore it has a great historical and artistic value. Its splendid bell tower with twelve bells is just 10 meters lower than that of Saint Mark’s in Venice, reaching 89,5 meters. The huge clock that decorates the building is 4 meters in diameter. It was made after a special request in Paris and was installed in 1862. In 1984, the craftsmen of the well-known Chech firm «Rieger-Kloss» created a unique «alter» organ and placed it in the previously restored cathedral. Since then the House of organ and chamber music operates there.

monuments.name: Church of the Icon of The Mother of God "Joy of All Sorrowful»
monuments.address: Stepova Street, 2-A, Bogorodichne village,  Kramatorsk district, Donetsk region
monuments.description: In 1847 a church was built in honour of the secret adviser Alexander Mikhailovich Potemkin on a hill above the village of Bohorodychne. In seven decades, the parish of the Church of the Mother of God has grown tenfold, so that as of 1908, two church-parish and Sunday schools were under its care. At the turn of the 1920s and 1930s, with amplification of the dictatorship of the proletariat and the atheistic policies of the Communist Party, the clergy were expelled from the Church of the Icon of the Mother of God «Joy of All Sorrowful», the parable house turned into a club, the church premises were adapted for a granary, and in 1938-1939 they were completely disassembled. On July 20, 2000, the cornerstone was laid in the foundation of the future church, and five years later, on February 14, it was sanctified by archimandrite Arseniy, the governor of the  Holy Assumption Sviatohirsk Monastery  in honour of the icon of the Mother of God "Joy of All Sorrowful».

monuments.name: Western House With a Spire
monuments.address: Kuindzhi Street, 48, Mariupol', Mariupol' district, Donetsk region
monuments.description: The building was constructed in 1953 on the site of the former city executive committee (the building was destroyed during the World War II). The author of the project is an architect from Kyiv L. Yanovytsky, who worked at the Kharkiv governmental architect company "Mis'kbudproekt."

monuments.name: St. Catherine's Cathedral
monuments.address: Donetska Street, 14A, Shchastya, Shchastinsky district, Luhansk region
monuments.description:
The church was built in 1914. During the October Revolution, the bolshevik Red Guards destroyed the upper part of the building and stole the bell. 

The church functioned as a stable, warehouse, granary, or glass container in different periods. 

The restoration began in 1990. A remarkable relic of the temple is a unique mosaic on the floor, which is perfectly preserved despite all the tragedies. 

Also, many citizens said that during World War II, the area around the church was damaged by explosions, but nothing happened to the church’s walls.

monuments.name: Mykhailo Kotsiubynsky manor house
monuments.address: Kotsiubynsky Street, 1, Chernihiv, Chernihiv region
monuments.description: The literary-memorial museum-reserve of a well-known writer Mykhailo Kotsiubynskyi was founded in Chernihiv in September 1934 on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of his birthday. The museum is based on the Mykhailo Kotsiubynsky’s memorial apartment, where he settled with his family in the summer of 1898 and spent his last and most productive 15 years of life. During the Chernihiv period the classic writer wrote his best works including “Intermezzo”, “Apple Blossom”, “At a High Cost”, “Fata Morgana” and “Shadows of the Forgotten Ancestors”, which brought him worldwide fame.

monuments.name: Kharkiv Art Museum
monuments.address: Zhon Myronosyts Street, 11, Kharkiv, Kharkiv district, Kharkiv region
monuments.description: The Kharkiv Art Museum is one of the largest museums in Ukraine. Its collection contains a significant number of works of fine, decorative, and applied arts from Ukraine, Russia, and Western countries. The building of the museum is the former estate of the millionaire industrialist Ivan Ignatishchev. One of the original versions of Ilya Repin's painting "Reply of the Zaporozhian Cossacks" is stored here. Vasyl Nazarovych Karazin was the founder of the Kharkiv Art Museum.

monuments.name: Holy Christ-Christmas Cathedral
monuments.address: Kosmonavtiv Street, 23, Severodonetsk, Severodonetsk district, Luhansk region
monuments.description: On the day of the Holy Trinity on June 19, 1994, the first foundation slab was consecrated and laid on a large square set aside for the construction of the cathedral. The temple was consecrated on February 25, 2000.  With the formation of the Severodonetsk Diocese on May 31, 2007, the Holy-Christ-Christmas Church received the status of a cathedral.

monuments.name: The Palace of Labor Building
monuments.address: Konstytutsii Square, 1, Kharkiv, Kharkiv region
monuments.description: The Palace of Labor is located in the center of Kharkiv. An insurance company built it in 1916 as a revenue house. While its ground floor was used for commercial needs, the remaining floors were filled with accomodation rooms. It was incredibly expensive to rent an apartment in the Palace of Labor. The building was contructed in the Neoclassical style. After the Bolshevik Revolution, the People's Commissariat for Labour and the All-Ukrainian Council of Trade Unions made use of the place. The Palace of Labor became its new name.

monuments.name: Assumption Church
monuments.address: Novyi Bykiv village, Nizhyn district, Chernihiv region
monuments.description: The Assumption church in Novyi Bykiv, Chernihiv region, was built in the years 1801-1804 under the order of the last hetman of Ukraine Kyrylo Rozumovskyi. The building was constructed in the Empire style.

monuments.name: Cathedral of Saint Michael the Archangel
monuments.address: Voiniv-Vyzvolyteliv Street, 3, Mariupol', Mariupol' district, Donetsk region
monuments.description: The first stone for the future Saint Michael Cathedral was laid in 1995. Two years later, in 1997, a bright and spacious six-dome church was built, which can accommodate up to a thousand parishioners.The main shrine of the cathedral is the icon of the Mother of God "Life-Giving Spring", created in the early XIX century. During World War II,  the icon was kept safe by the parishioners. When the threat disappeared, the image of the Mother of God was restored and returned to the church.

monuments.name: Central City Library
monuments.address: Shevchenka Street, 3-A, Irpin', Buchanskyi district, Kyiv region
monuments.description: The library was provided with premises totaling 1200 square meters in 1983 in the center of the city on former Lenin Street (Shevchenka Street today), designed according to typical project. In 2016, a reconstruction of these premises was carried out, resulting in major changes: modern design, comfortable environment for the visitors, an update of the multimedia equipment.

monuments.name: The Church of the Nativity of The Blessed Virgin
monuments.address: Pershogo Travnya Street, 65-B, Derhachi, Kharkiv district, Kharkiv region
monuments.description: The temple was consecrated in 1868. Priest Tymofiy Turanskiy (Yacov Turanskiy’s great grandson) perticipated in the construction of the church. With the advent of Soviet power and the beginning of atheistic politics, the Church of the Nativity of the Blessed Virgin ceased its services, and a workshop was opened there. During World War II, the services resumed, but the church was closed again in the 1950's. At the request of local residents in the 1960's,  the church resumed its services.

monuments.name: Local History Museum of Borodyanka region
monuments.address: Parkova Street, 1a, Borodyanka, Kyiv region
monuments.description: On November 20, 2021, the Museum of Local History of the Borodyanka region turned 5 years old. The museum's exposition included about 3,000 exhibits. Some exhibits dated from the XII-XVIII centuries. During its existence, the museum was visited by more than 6,500 people, including guests from 5 foreign countries.

monuments.name: Vasyl Slipak memorial stele
monuments.address: Luhanske urban-type settlement, Bakhmut district, Donetsk region
monuments.description: Vasyl Slipac died on 29 June 2016 near Luhanske. He was a singer of the Paris National Operahouse and participated in the Revolution of Dignity. The monument honoring him was built in 2019 by the headquarters of the 30th mechanized brigade with the help of volunteers Oleg Gandzha, Oleg Hrypun and Oleksandr Havryliuk.

monuments.name: Memorial to Vyacheslav Chornovil
monuments.address: Vyacheslava Chornovola Square, Antonivka, Kherson district, Kherson region
monuments.description: This granite slab was installed on a previously unnamed square near the Saliut shopping centre in Antonivka, when the Kherson city council made the decision to rename it to Vyacheslava Chornovola. Chornovil was an incredibly important individual in the early days of independent Ukraine, having fought against russification and national discrimination. This piece of cultural heritage was destroyed by russians amidst the occupation of Kherson.

monuments.name: Church of Christ the Savior of Evangelical Baptists
monuments.address: Morsky Bulvar, 44, Mariupol, Donetsk region
monuments.description: It is one of the most interesting religious buildings in Mariupol', because it differs significantly in its architectural style from traditional churches. Built in the XXI century in the late Modernism style, the church used to be an important center of the Protestant faith in Ukraine, as representatives of Evangelical Christians in Ukraine currently have 2,974 organizations.

monuments.name: Memorial complex to the Holocaust victims "Drobytsky Yar"
monuments.address: Shoseina street, 13, Mala Rohan village, Kharkiv district, Kharkiv region
monuments.description: Drobytsky Yar is a place of mass civilian executions carried out by Nazi occupation troops from 1941 to 1942. The first part of the memorial - the Menorah - was opened in 2002, and in 2005 - a mourning hall with the Bowl of sorrow, and tablets with the names of thouands of victims of the tragedy immortalized in history.

monuments.name: Church of St. George the Victorious
monuments.address: Popovycha Street 2-A, Irpin’, Bucha district, Kyiv region
monuments.description: The temple complex of the Ukrainian Orthodox Church was built in honor of St. George the Victorious. There is a parish church, administrative buildings, and a wooden chapel on the site.

monuments.name: Пожежна частина з каланчею
monuments.address: Харківська обл., Харківський р-н, м. Харків, вул. Квіткінська, 25
monuments.description: Пам’ятка архітектури, побудована у 1886 р. за проектом архітектора Г. Я. Стрижевського на «острівці» — колишній Квіткинській площі. На станції з наглядовою вежею розміщувалися підрозділ, районний відділ і дослідно-випробувальна лабораторія Міністерства надзвичайних ситуацій (МНС).

monuments.name: Izium fortress
monuments.address: Kremyanets mountain, Izium, Izium district, Kharkiv region
monuments.description: The fortress was built in 1681 on the right bank of the Siverskyi Donets river, under the Tzar's decree, with a goal of strengthening the defensive line of Moscovia from Tatar invasions. The construction was supervised by Colonel Hryhorii Donets-Zakharzhevskyi. The Izium Fortress became not only an obstacle for the Tatar raids, but also a terror for the Zaporizhtsi. Free settlers and Cossacks from Zaporizhzhia lived southwards from the Izium line. The Sloboda Cossacks of the Izium Regiment had to fight with their brothers-in-arms.

monuments.name: Monument to V. G. Korolenko
monuments.address: Myru Ave, 43, Mariupol', Mariupol' district, Donetsk region
monuments.description:
A monument honoring a Ukrainian-born writer, journalist, publicist, and a public figure Volodymyr Galaktionovych Korolenko (1853-1921). 

The monument was erected in Mariupol in 1966 in front of the Teatral'na Square.

monuments.name: Bust of Taras Shevchenko
monuments.address: Myru Ave, 42, Mariupol', Mariupol' district, Donetsk region
monuments.description:
The monument appeared in the city in 1964 to celebrate 150 years from the birth of Kobzar. 

The bust of the poet, made of stone and built on cement stele.

monuments.name: Sviato-Preobrazhenska church
monuments.address: Vidradna Street, 22, Mariupol', Mariupol' district, Donetsk region
monuments.description: This church originated as the St. Nicholas' House of Worship in 1915, located on Kerchenska street in Mariupol. In 1975, it was moved to a different building by the address of Vidradna st., 22. On the 6th of November that year, it was sanctified. After a new temple of St.Nicholas was opened, the name of this church was changed to Sviato-Preobrazhenska. A Sunday school used to function here.

monuments.name: Memorial cemetery with a memorial sign to the dead and a chapel of St. Archangel Michael
monuments.address: Klenova Street, Cemetery "Yatsevo", Chernihiv, Chernihiv district, Chernihiv region
monuments.description: Yatsevo is the largest cemetery in Chernihiv and one of the 10 largest cemeteries in Ukraine. It was opened in 1974. In 1996, the Church of St. Feodosiy was built on the territory of the cemetery. On November 21, 2018, the chapel of the Archangel Michael was solemnly opened in honor of the soldiers who lost their lives protecting Ukraine. The cemetery has a separate area where the soldiers who lost their lives during World War II were reburied. 15 Soviet soldiers were reburied there on June 22, 2009.

monuments.name: Holy Dormition Church
monuments.address: Surikova Street, 36, Mariupol', Mariupol' district, Donetsk region
monuments.description: The church was founded in 1780 by Metropolitan Ignatius but 14 years later fell into disrepair. The new Church of the Dormition was consecrated in 1804, but this building was also short-lived. Decades later, the second building was demolished and a third was built, which was consecrated in 1887. The Church of the Dormition housed a particularly revered icon of the Mother of God Hodegetria, taken by the Greeks from Crimea. The Church of the Dormition was blown up and in 1936 on its place a secondary school № 36 was built. In 1989, the Holy Dormition Church, which belongs to the Ukrainian Orthodox Church, was built on the site of the school. As a result of the Russian-Ukrainian war in 2022, it was almost completely destroyed.

monuments.name: Cultural centre "Ukrainian House"
monuments.address: Metalurhiv Ave, 150, Mariupol', Mariupol' district, Donetsk region
monuments.description:
The Ukrainian House is a community palace of culture in Mariupol, formerly known as the Palace of Culture of the Metallurgists, built in 1982. 

At the initiative of the city council, during the times of independant Ukraine, the building was reconstructed into a multifunctional art center, which aims to cover the cultural needs of the Mariupol community. 

Various cultural events are held in the Ukrainian House: concerts, performances, film screenings, etc. 

The slogan of the place is "inspiration lives here".

monuments.name: Church of Assumption of Mary
monuments.address: Tereshkovoyi Street 42A, Korobochkyne Village, Chuguiv district, Kharkiv region
monuments.description: The local orthodox community was founded on November 18, 1991. A different building used to be here, which was then gifted for religious purposes. In 2006, the building still looked like a traditional Ukrainian hlynianka (clay house), so it would be hard to differentiate between it and the neighboring houses, if it wasn't for a small cupola. The church was later reconstructed using bright bricks. Archbishop Elisey of Izyum and Kup'yans'k consecrated the church on July 10, 2017, on the holiday of Pentecost. Some pictures of the church dating back to imperial times are still intact today.

monuments.name: House of Prayer of Evangelical Baptist Christians “Vifaniya”
monuments.address: Volochaivs’ka Street, 91, Mariupol, Mariupol district, Donetsk region
monuments.description: Before the war, in the peacetime, the church played an important role in the social and evangelistic life of the city. The choir singing seemed to never stop, the musicians played, weddings and baptisms were celebrated. Regular live broadcasts of services were held on YouTube. During the quarantine, taking the opportunity, the brothers renovated the church. The church stood for only thirty years in the prosperous city of Mariupol.

monuments.name: Church of st. Illia and Andriy Pervozvanny
monuments.address: Hostomel highway, 47-49, Hostomel, Bucha district, Kyiv region
monuments.description: The church has long been founded in Mostyshche, which in 1967 came under the administrative subordination of Gostomel. The church has its own shrine, a miraculous image of the Virgin, painted by Mostyshchany, now deceased Mykola Roh. The Church of St. Andrew the First-Called was founded in 1887. It was a majestic temple with a large dome, on this site is now a mass grave and a memorial to the soldiers of World War II. In 1901, one of the best church and parish schools was built next to the church, where children still study. The priest's house has also been preserved.

monuments.name: Byshiv House of Culture
monuments.address: Kyivska Street, 50, Byshiv village, Makariv District, Kyiv region
monuments.description: This House of Culture is located in the quaint and charming Byshiv village, which was founded in 1499 and is now 523 years old. This building was abandoned in the early 2000s and has not been renovated for nearly 20 years. Through the initiative of the locals, money for the renovation was raised. Byshiv House of Culture was only open for two years since 2020, for entertainment and cultural purposes.

monuments.name: Mykolaivska Church
monuments.address: Zahaltsi village, Bucha district, Kyiv region
monuments.description: The Community of Mykolaiv church was created in the 1990s and consisted of nearly 50 active parishioners. The church is medium in size, and on big Christian holidays, there were a few hundred people standing in and out of the church. The parish had recently started building a new temple 500 meters away from the old one, but the fights near it took part. There is no information about the condition of the building at this time.

monuments.name: Mass grave of Soviet soldiers
monuments.address: Sumska Street, Bytytsya, Sumy district, Sumy region
monuments.description:
The memorial is an important local cultural site - mass gave of soviet soldiers, 

Soviet soldiers who took part in the German-Soviet War (The Eastern Front of World War II, 1941-1945) are buried in this grave. 

The exact number of liberators resting there is unknown.

monuments.name: "Prystan Spasinna" church
monuments.address: Krasnoflotska Street, 37, Mariupol', Mariupol' district, Donetsk region
monuments.description: A newly-built church in the Prymorskyi district of Mariupol.

monuments.name: The State Bank in Mariupol
monuments.address: Greek Street, 43, Mariupol', Mariupol' district, Donetsk region
monuments.description:
When the prospects of building metallurgical enterprises outside the city appeared in the 90s of the XIX century, an office of the State Bank of the III category was opened in 1885. 

For its construction, a project for a two-storey building was ordered in the capital. 

Despite the constant significant increase in turnover of the local branch of the State Bank, it took eight long years to raise the building in the classical style. In fact, throughout the 20th century, major Mariupol projects were financially implemented within these walls, which represented the state banking system. 

Both the construction of the metallurgical facility 'Azovstal' and the restoration of the residential part of the city were funded from there after the devastation of World War II.

monuments.name: Holy Trinity Church
monuments.address: Troyiczka Street, 46, Mariupol', Mariupol' district, Donetsk region
monuments.description:
The temporary building of a church was erected in 2006, and a Sunday school and drawing classes were opened there at the same time. 

The consecration of the Holy Trinity Church (the Mykolayiv denomination) in Mariupol took place on May 27. 

The Great Consecration of the church was performed by the ruling bishop, His Eminence Metropolitan Hilarion of Donetsk and Mariupol.

Hilarion celebrated the Divine Liturgy in the temple right after its consecration.

monuments.name: The Church of The Three Saints
monuments.address: Sportyvna Street, Popasna, Severodontesk district, Luhansk region
monuments.description: The construction of the Church of the Three Saints in Popasna began in 2012. In 2018, Metropolitan Nicodemus of Severodonetsk and Starobilsk consecrated it as well as the statue of the Holy Mother of God (erected near the church a few days before the consecration). As a result of the shelling, one of the domes and walls in the church was destroyed, and the interior decorations were damaged.

monuments.name: Library-Archive Vyacheslav Chornovil's Fund
monuments.address: Lisova Bucha neighborhood, Bucha, Bucha district, Kyiv region
monuments.description:
An archive of Ukrainian political prisoners Vyacheslav Chornovil and Mykola Plahotniuk. 

The archive was created by Chornovil's sister Valentyna and nephew Bogdan Plahotniuk. 

Approximately 60 sets of the ten-volume Chornovil's work were stred there. 

Books of Chornovil's Fund and archives of political prisoner Mykola Plahotniuk's were also stored there. 

Only few of Plahotniuk's notebooks survived the explotion.

monuments.name: Chapel of the Immaculate Conception of the Blessed Virgin Mary
monuments.address: Kyselivka village, Mykolaiv district, Mykolaiv region
monuments.description:
The Chapel of the Immaculate Conception of the Blessed Virgin was built in 1852. 

After Bolsheviks came to power, the Chapel was shut down and closed, 4 valuable icons dissapeared. 

In the 1930's the Chapel was transformed into a grain storage room until 1995. 

In 1999, the Chapel was reconstructed on the outside and partly on the inside.

monuments.name: Memorial to deceased soldiers from ATO zone
monuments.address: Mangush urban-type settlement, Mariupol district, Donetsk region
monuments.description:
A memorial honoring the participants of "ATO" (Joint Forces Operation). 

The memorial has a caption on the front part that says “To the soldiers who gave their lives for Ukraine”.

monuments.name: Stele in memory of "Our compatriots-defenders of Ukraine who died in the ATO / Joint Forces Operation"
monuments.address: Central Street, 230, Borodianka urban-type settlement, Bucha district, Kyiv region
monuments.description: On October 13, 2020, a monument honoring soldiers who gave their lives during the "АТО" (Joint Forces Operation) was erected in Borodyanka. This memorial honors the heroes who gave their lives for the freedom and independence of Ukraine. The monument was created by their relatives and friends, the head of the village the leadership of Borodyanka district initiative, supported by regional, district and village deputies and community representatives.

monuments.name: Air terminal
monuments.address: Airport, Shestovytsya village, Chernihiv district, Chernihiv region
monuments.description:
A former civil airport in Ukraine, located 15 km southwest of Chernihiv within the territorial community of Chernihiv. 

Built in 1986, it mainly operated domestic flights within Ukraine, although there were international flights, too. It worked until 1994. 

Due to a bankruptcy, the air terminal was closed in 2002. In 2017, parts of the Ukrainian blockbuster "Cyborgs: Heroes Never Die" were shot at the airport.

monuments.name: Costyantynivs'ka Mosque
monuments.address: Vysokovoltna Street, 23, Costyantynivka, Donetsk region
monuments.description: The mosque in Costyantynivka was built for 4 years (2019-2022) at the expense of the local Muslim community. At the time of the damage, the mosque already had a golden dome. The Muslim center of Bakhmut was built near the Bakhmut Industrial College. The future mosque was located in the area of private houses. Earlier, this place was an old house gifted to the head of the Muslim community in Bakhmut Alan Karibov.

monuments.name: City Palace of Culture
monuments.address: Peremohy Ave, 1, Lozova, Lozova district, Kharkiv region
monuments.description: The total number of participants in various club formations was 828. The Palace had 9 vocal club formations, 1 choral, 10 choreographic, 6 theatrical, 2 instrumental ensembles, a spiritual orchestra, 2 folklore orchestras, 2 movie clubs, photo enthusiast formations, etc. The choir of the Ukrainian song "Zaspiv" and the pantomime studio "Lik" worked there. In 2012 only the Palace held 198 events.

monuments.name: School of Music (modern building)
monuments.address: Shevchenko Street, 84, Sviatohirsk, Kramatorsk district, Donetsk region
monuments.description: School of Music in Sviatohirsk was registered as a public institution in 1973. In 2016, the Japanese government helped with the reconstruction of the school. It was part of the project called "Promoting community stabilization in Donbas".

monuments.name: Central City Library
monuments.address: Tsentralny Ave 54, Severodonetsk, Severodonetsk district, Luhansk region
monuments.description: On the 22nd of October 2009 by the decision of Severodonetsk City Council a municipal institution of Severodonetsk Public City Library was established. The library fund includes 160 804 copies. And the amount of readers is over 11 thousand. Since 2011 there is an Internet access center in the library.

monuments.name: All Saints Skete of Sviatohirsk Cave Monastery
monuments.address: Tetyanivka, Kramatorsk district, Donetsk region
monuments.description: The skete is extremely beautiful. Its temples have been made by local carpenters of massive pine decks and decorated with carving according to traditional wooden architecture of ancient Rus (XVI-XVII). Wooden cells nearby remind of antique terems. The skete is surrounded by wooden stockade with tessa gates and corner towers.

monuments.name: Мозаїчні панно “Дерево життя” та “Боривітер”
monuments.address: Донецька обл., Маріупольський р-н, м. Маріуполь, проспект Миру, 48
monuments.description: Мозаїки були створені в інтер'єрі ресторану "Україна" бригадою митців (А.Горська, В.Зарецький, Г. Зубченко, Б.Плаксій, Г.Пришедько за участі  В.Прахніна Н. Світличної) впродовж творчого відрядження в Маріуполь, що тривало з 23 травня до 12 червня 1967 року. Після смерті Алли Горської панно "Дерево життя" замурували цегляною кладкою, бо залишати на огляд роботу відомої дисидентки із зображенням дерева, що символізує вічне життя, було неприйнятно. Демонтували цю стіну і знову відкрили мозаїкуу 2008 році. Оскільки приміщення ресторану впродовж багатьох років не використовувалося, "Дерево Життя" та "Боривітер" були недоступні для широкого огляду. Маріупольська спільнота мала змогу знову побачити ці мозаїчні панно у 2018 році завдяки проєкту "Жовта лiнiя".

monuments.name: Palace of Culture
monuments.address: Volodymyrska Street 1, Rynok Square, Severodonetsk district, Luhansk region
monuments.description:
The Palace of Culture held events like state and folk holidays celebrations, theatrical performances, competitions and festivals, that revealed the talent of citizens, themed evenings for professional occasions of individual organizations.

Creative teams of the Palace perform concerts to promote the best samples of musical, theatrical, choral and choreographic genres among the residents of the city. They also constantly take part in festivals and competitions of different levels (city, regional, national, international) and achieve success there enhancing the prestige and fame of the city.

monuments.name: Korabelny Palace of Culture (1959 building)
monuments.address: Bohoyavlenskii Ave 328, Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv district, Mykolaiv region
monuments.description:
In 1955 the construction of the House of Culture of the Okean shipbuilding factory, which was established nearby four years before, started.

The building process was over in 1959 and it was the beginning of creative life in the House. The style of the building is neoclassicism with elements of baroque. This is the most vivid architectural example of that time. 

In 2015 the House of Culture was reorganized into Mykolaiv City Korabelny Palace of Culture.

It was the center of cultural life of Korabelny district before the destruction. The majority of local concerts, festivals and other events was initiated there.

monuments.name: House of Officers
monuments.address: Kotsyubinskoho Ave 37, Vinnytsia, Vinnytsia district, Vinnytsia region
monuments.description:
The history of the House of Officers begins with the opening of the House of Red Army in Vinnytsia on the Kozynskoho Street on the 31th of December 1925 by the civil war hero Janis Fabriciuss.

During the war the building was damaged and all wooden structures were destroyed.
In 1946-1947 it was renovated. On the 25th of September 1947 the House of Red Army started running.

Since the 28th of December 2004 the House of Officers of Military-Air Forces of Ukrainian Armed Forces has been transfered to Air Forces of Ukrainian Armed Forces.

The auditorium contains almost 1000 seats and is known as the biggest in the city and region.

monuments.name: St. Feodosius of Chernihiv Church (2006 building)
monuments.address: Tsentralna Street 8, Stavky, Kramatorsk district, Donetsk region
monuments.description: The church was opened in 2008.The orthodox literature library with over 4 000 books has been founded there. As well as the Sunday school with medical center, handicraft group and sport section. There is a football pitch and a playground nearby.

monuments.name: Church of Mykola
monuments.address: Pryvokzalna Street 25-B, Lyman, Kramatorsk district, Donetsk region
monuments.description:
"In 2004 His Eminence Metropolitan of Donetsk and Mariupol Hilarion blessed the intention of building a new temple in Pivdennyi neighborhood of Lyman. 

In August the place was consecrated for the process and construction was started. 

The ground floor was built in 2007. On the 19th of December Bishop Alypius with the temple Abbot Archpriest Serhiy Kirkach and other clergy performed first Divine Liturgy in the new church. 

Today it is the side altar of the Saint Mykola Church where the altar is consecrated in honor of righteous lad Artemius of Verkola.

The first Divine Liturgy in the Saint Mykola Church was performed on the 28th of August 2008."

monuments.name: Будинок культури
monuments.address: Миколаївська обл., Баштанський р-н, с. Широке, вул. Шкільна, 1
monuments.description:
"Будинок культури працює з 1960 року.  

У Будинку культури представлені музичні, вокальні, а також театральні та танцювальні  гуртки. 

Присутні вокальні ансамблі, музикально-інструментальні гурти, фітнес заняття та кінотеатр. 

В стінах Будинку культури є Народний Історико-Краєзнавчий музей.

Саме тут організовуються всі святкові концерти та безліч культурних вечорів селища та всієї громади.

monuments.name: Будинок культури
monuments.address: Харківська обл., Чугуївський р-н, м. Чугуїв, вул. Гвардійська, 13
monuments.description:
"Будинок культури введений в експлуатацію в 1962 році. 

Загальна площа закладу 3289 кв.м. В РБК працює 8 вокальних клубних формування (з них 3 дитячі), хорове, 5 хореографічних, 2 театральні(дитячі), фольклорне, народних промислів, клуб за інтересами. 

Загальна кількість учасників клубних формувань – 282 чол. На базі РБК функціонує один колектив зі званням «Народний аматорський колектив» (дорослий). 

За 2012 рік здійснено 23 виїзди колективів та окремих виконавців на конкурси, фестивалі, огляди. 

Колективи будинку культури мають в своєму активі 39 міжнародних, 7 всеукраїнських, 10 обласних, 11 регіональних і 2 районні нагород і звань.

monuments.name: Церква “Слово істини”
monuments.address: Донецька обл., Маріупольський р-н, м. Маріуполь, вул. Зінцева Балка, 63 (1-й узвіз Зінцева Балка, 26)
monuments.description: Біблійна реформаторська місіонерська церква Маріуполя, яка існує з 2013 року та входить до Об'єднання Біблійних місіонерських Церков України (ОБМЦУ).

monuments.name: Luhansk Regional Theatre of Ukrainian Music and Drama (1960s building)
monuments.address: Druzhby Narodiv Boulevard 21, Severodonetsk, Severodonetsk district, Luhansk region
monuments.description:
In 2014 the theater was evacuated to Severodonetsk due to russian occupation. 

It was placed in a building of Severodonetsk Theater of Drama established in 1960s.

monuments.name: Volodymyr Church of Christ
monuments.address: Petropavlivska Street 87, Lyman, Kramatorsk district, Donetsk region
monuments.description: The ancient church, built at the turn of the XX-XXI centuries.

monuments.name: Roadside wooden cross
monuments.address: Mykolayivka, Kramatorsk district, Donetsk region
monuments.description: An enormous wooden cross placed exactly in the way to Mykolayivka city. It was made by Oleksandr Gusev.

monuments.name: Церква св. Макарія
monuments.address: Донецька обл., Бахмутський р-н, м. Торецьк, вул. Маяковського, 12-А
monuments.description: Церква дерев'яна на цегляному підмурку, однонавна, двобанна. Площини фасадів розчленовано високими прямокутними вікнами й тонкими лопатками, декорованими накладними дошками з геометричним рисунком. Над вівтарною частиною і бабинцем височать два шатрові верхи, вирішені як різновисокі восьмигранні двоярусні вежі, увінчані пірамідальними баньками з позолоченими ліхтариками-маківками. Завершені однотипними трикутними фронтонами бабинець та основний об'єм нави послідовно підвищуються, ніби нагромаджуючи зусилля, що реалізується у стрімкому злеті дзвіниці, яка відіграє роль основної домінанти храму.

monuments.name: Меморіал загиблих воїнів-маріупольців, які захищали Україну
monuments.address: Донецька обл., Маріупольський р-н, м. Маріуполь, майдан Свободи
monuments.description: Меморіал був відкритий разом з реконструйованою площею Свободи і складав частину загальної концепції ансамблю. Він присвячений усім військовослужбовцям, які загинули, захищаючи Маріуполь та Україну.  По гранітній стелі в формі українського герба струмує вода як символ пролитих сліз. Вода омиває бронзові дубові листя. На кожному листі  - ім’я загиблого героя.

monuments.name: Миколаївська церква
monuments.address: Луганська обл., Сєвєродонецький р-н, смт Борівське, вул. Шкільна, 2-А
monuments.description: Наприкінці 1989 року, незадовго до розпаду СРСР, Свято-Миколаївська церква отримала шанс на нове життя. Із того часу тут безупинно велися реставраційні роботи коштом благодійників та простих вірян. 2003 року церкві повернули 20-метрову дзвіницю, і мешканці Попасної нарешті знову почули святковий передзвін. Улітку 2022 року громада міста збиралася відзначати 115-річчя храму.

monuments.name: Братська могила радянських воїнів
monuments.address: Луганська обл., Сєвєродонецький р-н, м. Рубіжне, проспект Переможців
monuments.description: Попереду пам'ятника розміщена братська могила. На ній встановлена плита, на якій вигравірувано прізвища 63 захоронених воїнів. Обеліск встановлено на постаменті, на кожній із чотирьох сторін нижньої частини обеліску розміщені багатофігурні барельєфні зображення бойових епізодів Другої Світової Війни. Площадка викладена сірим та рожевим базальтом.

monuments.name: Каплиця на честь св. Серафіма Саровського
monuments.address: Луганська обл., Сєвєродонецький р-н, м. Сєвєродонецьк, перетин вул. Єгорова та вул. Об’їзної
monuments.description: Стараннями митрополита Сєвєродонецького і Старобільського Никодима, на кожному з семи в'їздів до Сєвєродонецька збудували каплиці. У мирний час навколо міста проводилися хресні ходи, під час яких у кожній з каплиць віруючі і духовенство зупинялися для молитви.

monuments.name: Каплиця на честь св. Миколая Мірлікійського
monuments.address: Луганська обл., Сєвєродонецький р-н, м. Сєвєродонецьк, на в’їзді до міста
monuments.description: Стараннями митрополита Сєвєродонецького і Старобільського Никодима, на кожному з семи в'їздів до Сєвєродонецька збудували каплиці. У мирний час навколо міста проводилися хресні ходи, під час яких у кожній з каплиць віруючі і духовенство зупинялися для молитви.

monuments.name: Братська могила
monuments.address: Запорізька обл., Пологівський р-н, с. Вербове, сільський цвинтар
monuments.description:
19 вересня 1943 р. частиною 50 гвардійської стрілкової дивізії Південного фронту було вигнано фашистських окупантів з с. Вербове. Кровопролитні бої проходили в 6-8 км від села.

В братській могилі, що розташована в центрі села, поховано 972 радянських воїнів, загиблих у роки Другої світової війни 1941-45 років.

У 1969-85 роках на братській могилі на честь загиблих односельців було встановлено пам’ятник «Скорботна мати».

monuments.name: Хоральна синагога
monuments.address: Донецька обл., Маріупольський р-н, м. Маріуполь, вул. Миколаївська, 28
monuments.description:
Старовинна будівлі колишньої хоральної синагоги, збудованої на початку ХХ століття. 

Останніми роками будівля використовувалася як церква Маріупольської християнської громади адвентистів сьомого дня.

monuments.name: Музей історії та археології
monuments.address: Донецька обл., Маріупольський р-н, м. Маріуполь, проспект Будівельників, 129, корпус 2
monuments.description:
Музей історії та археології був створений у 2016 році на честь 25-річчя Маріупольського державного університету.

Експозиція налічує близько 500 експонатів і тематично розділена на дві частини, перша з яких ілюструє процес становлення і розвитку університету, а друга – результати роботи Археологічної експедиції МДУ, створеної у 1997 році.

У музеї проводяться оглядові і тематичні екскурсії, засідання студентського наукового історико-археологічного товариства МДУ, засідання кіноклубу медіапросвіти Docudays UA «Human Rights», уроки-екскурсії, та профорієнтаційні заходи для маріупольських школярів. Також співробітники музею надають консультації з питань історії, археології та краєзнавства.

Екскурсоводами часто виступають студенти-історики.

monuments.name: Молитовний будинок “Христос є відповідь”
monuments.address: Луганська обл., Сєвєродонецький р-н, м. Рубіжне, вул. Володимирська, 5
monuments.description: "Сучасна будівля молитовного будинку євангельської місії “Христос є відповідь”.

monuments.name: Церква св. Миколая
monuments.address: Херсонська обл., Бериславський р-н, с. Новопавлівка
monuments.description: "Старовинна будівлі церкви св. Миколая Чудотворця, зведена в 1882 р.

monuments.name: Успенська церква
monuments.address: Херсонська обл., Бериславський р-н, м. Берислав, вул. Успенська
monuments.description:
"У 1835 році у місті Бериславі було освячено одну з найстаріших церков Херсонщини – Успенську, закладену ще у 1811 році. 

При радянській владі культова споруда перетворилася на майданчик для спортзалу педучилища. 

Наразі закінчені реставраційні роботи і собор є цілком історичною пам’яткою міста.

У Державному архіві зберігається метрична книга Успенської церкви за 1855 рік, де наведено прізвища солдат, які поступили до шпиталю з місць боїв під час Кримської війни та померлих у Бериславському військовому шпиталі.

monuments.name: Гімназія № 2
monuments.address: Донецька обл., Покровський р-н, м. Курахове, вул. Пушкіна, 11-А
monuments.description: Старовинна будівля гімназії № 2, зведена у 1938 р.

monuments.name: Кінотеатр “Мультіплекс”
monuments.address: Донецька обл., Маріупольський р-н, м. Маріуполь, Запорізьке шосе, 2
monuments.description: Сучасна будівля кінотеатру “Мультіплекс”, розташований в приміщеннях торгівельно-розважального центру “ПортСіті” у Маріуполі.

monuments.name: Братська могила 179 воїнів
monuments.address: Запорізька обл., Василівський р-н, с. Приморське, вул. Центральна
monuments.description: Пам'ятка архітектури, містобудування та історії місцевого значення - будівля колишньої жіночої гімназії, зведеної у 1893-97 рр.

monuments.name: Театр Монте
monuments.address: Миколаївська обл., Миколаївський р-н, м. Миколаїв, вул. Адміральська, 25-27
monuments.description:
Пам’ятка архітектури та історії місцевого значення - будівля колишнього приватного театру Монте, зведена у 1881 р. 

Нині в будівлі розміщується Миколаївський академічний художній драматичний театр. На подвір’ї театру красуютьчя садові скульптури.

monuments.name: Школа мистецтв та бібліотека
monuments.address: Донецька обл., Бахмутський р-н, м. Часів Яр, вул. Цілинників, 2-3
monuments.description: Сучасна будівля дитячої школи мистецтв та публічної бібліотеки, в яких зберігатись музичне устаткування та бібліотечні збірки книг.

monuments.name: Церква св. Миколая
monuments.address: Харківська обл., Куп’янський р-н, м. Куп’янськ, площа Центральна, 2
monuments.description: Пам’ятка архітектури місцевого значення - церква св. Миколая, збудована у 1850-52 рр та прилеглі до храму сучасні церковні будівлі крамниці та школи.

monuments.name: Пам’ятник Мирославу Мислі
monuments.address: Харківська обл., Чугуївський р-н, с. Волохів Яр
monuments.description: Пам’ятник захиснику Україні Мирославу Мислі, встановлений у 2016 р. на могилі героя.

monuments.name: Церква Різдва Пресвятої Богородиці
monuments.address: Донецька обл., Бахмутський р-н, с. Верхньокам’янське, вул. Землянова, 146-Б
monuments.description: Греко-католицькв церквв Різдва Пресвятої Богородиці, збудована у 1990-91 рр.

monuments.name: Церква св. Миколая
monuments.address: Миколаївська обл., Миколаївський р-н, м. Очаків, вул. 8 Березня, 1
monuments.description: Старовинна будівля православної церкви св. Миколая, зведена у першій половині ХХ ст. як господарський корпус військового шпиталю та пристосованої для богослужінь у 1945 р.

monuments.name: Свято-Покровська церква
monuments.address: Луганська обл., Сєвєродонецький р-н, м. Кремінна, провулок Дитячий, 2
monuments.description: Сучасна будівля православної Свято-Покровської церкви.

monuments.name: Парк імені Тараса Шевченка
monuments.address: Київська обл., Київський р-н, м. Київ, вул. Володимирська
monuments.description:
Парк заснований 1860 року під назвою Університетський сквер. 

У 1896 році у парку відкрито пам'ятник Миколі I, який був знесений більшовиками 1920 року. 

1939 року, з нагоди 125-річчя від дня народження Тараса Шевченка, на місці колишнього пам'ятника Миколі І було відкрито пам'ятник Тарасові Шевченку, роботи скульптора Матвія Манізера. 

На 1938 рік скульптором із учнями була створена скульптура, про яку Лазар Каганович сказав, що «цей Шевченко буде закликати до повалення колгоспного ладу», і авторові довелося виконати скульптуру за ідеєю більшовицьких керівників.
